body_html:
Note that for imaginary eigenvalues, torch.eig only returns the real part of the eigenvectors, but does seem to consider the imaginary part in the normalisation. (Apologies for the inaccurate earlier comment.)
I think the outcome of #4533 might also be relevant if you want derivatives of the eigenvectors w.r.t. the inputs.
body_text:
Note that for imaginary eigenvalues, torch.eig only returns the real part of the eigenvectors, but does seem to consider the imaginary part in the normalisation. (Apologies for the inaccurate earlier comment.)
I think the outcome of #4533 might also be relevant if you want derivatives of the eigenvectors w.r.t. the inputs.
body:
Note that for imaginary eigenvalues, `torch.eig` only returns the real part of the eigenvectors, but does seem to consider the imaginary part in the normalisation. (Apologies for the inaccurate earlier comment.)
I think the outcome of #4533 might also be relevant if you want derivatives of the eigenvectors w.r.t. the inputs.
